snippet: Tulsa, Okla., saying it can offer plenty of room, wants to host the 2024 Summer Games and join the likes of Athens, Beijing and London in Olympic history.
abstract: Supporters like Neil Mavis, who has organized group Tulsa 2024, are pushing for Tulsa, Okla, to host 2024 Summer Olympics, despite its long-shot odds against joining the ranks of cities like Athens, Beijing and London; boosters argue while city lacks requisite hotel space, workforce and facilities, its location would offer world legitimate glimpse of American heartland.
lead_paragraph: Tulsa, Okla., saying it can offer plenty of room, wants to host the 2024 Summer Games and join the likes of Athens, Beijing and London in Olympic history.

headline.main: London. Tokyo. Athens. Tulsa? A Heartland Olympic Dream
